articles.author: Kate Dennett
articles.title: John Lydon claims Sex Pistols are 'tastelessly' trying to 'cash in' on the Queen's death - Daily Mail
articles.description: The singer, 66, said he is 'distancing' himself from any activity from the  band which aims to promote their 1977 track, claiming it is 'disrespectful' to the Royal Family.
articles.content:
John Lydon has claimed that his former band Sex Pistols are 'tastelessly' trying to 'cash in' on the Queen's death with their punk single God Save The Queen.
